userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Winborne Family Papers, WLU Coll. 0254, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA.
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Blue sheet prepared by Betty Kondayan (1/21/01)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Roger M. Winborne, Jr. was a member of the Washington and Lee University class of 1946 who later worked as a physician in Roanoke, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Family papers include Winborne Jr.'s school papers and notebooks from his years at Washington and Lee University, as well as information about his fraternity, Delta Tau Delta. Three folders contain printed matter about his father, Roger M. Winborne, a Class of 1911 graduate of Washington and Lee University Law School.
